alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued October 08 at 3:00AM CDT until October 08 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 34 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...In Kansas, Smith and Jewell Counties. In Nebraska, Gosper, Phelps, Kearney, Furnas, Harlan, Franklin and Webster Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to a stubborn deck of clouds in place, there is some uncertainty whether temperatures will get cold enough to allow frost formation. If these clouds remain in place, frost will be less likely. However, if clouds manage to clear at or before sunrise, then temperatures could quickly drop and allow at least brief frost development.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
